artist: Frank Lloyd Wright; Matthews Brothers Furniture Company
creditline: Gift of funds from the Regis Corporation
description: Four heavy octagonal legs with casters; legs on short sides connected by a screen of four-sided spindles; long octagonal spindles connect screens
dimension: 28 3/4 x 54 3/4 x 60 3/16 in. (73.03 x 139.07 x 152.88 cm) (overall, without leaves)
text: Formal, stark, uniform, uncomfortable—this dining set is all of these things. Wright was going for intimacy, the tall backs of the chairs encircling the dining table like screens, creating a room within a room. He designed many more sets like this, the spindles on the chair backs echoing the simple geometry of the architecture, though he didn’t often use the octagonal elements seen here.
title: Table, from a dining set
